title: Title by Mike Perry in Untitled 001 fashion magazine, similar to Didot
content:
I was just looking to know what typeface this is. It looks incredibly similar to Didot.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 9.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164938/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%209_1.png) | 71.88 KB |

 [‹ New Official Premier League Lettering+Numbering](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164938/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34210 "Go to previous forum topic") [Retro 50s style upright connected script on "Swell" books ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164938/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33925 "Go to next forum topic")
author: gavinp

comments.content: When is this from? It looks like custom lettering from the sixties.
This is from a very recent fashion magazine titled Untitled No. 001 by Mike Perry
It’s not a modern, it’s a transitional. A Scotch.
Talk about a coincidence — just yesterday I checked the man’s website through a link on Typographer.org (we’re back up BTW).
Yeah, it’s a type I’ve seen before. I believe Mike Perry’s friend, neitherfishnorfowl(.com) has used the same type before.
